Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Dating: 2ND INTERMEDIATE PERIOD (not after); MIDDLE KINGDOM (not before)
Name: Scarab
Description: Fragment of a lovely, clearly depicted scarab (head, clypeus, crenellated legs). The reverse bears a spiral motif generally called Hyksos. However, prints of such stamps are frequently found in Nubian forts and appear from the Middle Kingdom onwards.
